name: Dexmethylphenidate (Focalin)
summary: A central nervous system stimulant used to treat attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
description: Dexmethylphenidate is the d-threo-enantiomer of methylphenidate and is thought to be the more pharmacologically active form. It blocks the reuptake of norepinephrine and dopamine into presynaptic neurons, increasing their levels in the synaptic cleft. Dexmethylphenidate is indicated for the treatment of ADHD in children, adolescents, and adults, and may have a lower required dose compared to racemic methylphenidate.

sections.text: Dexmethylphenidate inhibits the reuptake of dopamine and norepinephrine into presynaptic neurons by blocking their transporters, leading to increased neurotransmitter availability in the brain.

adult.adhd: Start at 2.5–5 mg twice daily (IR) or 10 mg once daily (XR); titrate weekly in 2.5–5 mg increments for IR or 10 mg increments for XR; max 20 mg/day IR or 40 mg/day XR

sections.pediatric: Same starting doses; adjust based on age and response

items: Extended-release capsules: 5 mg, 10 mg, 15 mg, 20 mg, 25 mg, 30 mg, 35 mg, 40 mg

sections.text: IR: Onset in 20–60 minutes, duration 3–5 hours; XR: Onset in 20–60 minutes, duration up to 12 hours.

serious: sudden cardiac death in predisposed patients

sections.black_box: CNS stimulants have a high potential for abuse and dependence.
other: Assess risk of abuse before prescribing
May exacerbate pre-existing psychosis or bipolar disorder

sections.pregnancy: Use only if potential benefits justify potential risks
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in human milk; caution advised
sections.pediatrics: Approved for use in children aged 6 and older

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose to minimize withdrawal symptoms such as fatigue and depression.

items: Dexmethylphenidate is approximately twice as potent as racemic methylphenidate; dose accordingly
Extended-release formulation allows once-daily dosing, improving adherence
